title: Solak: The five best QB debuts of Week 1, plus what the Giants should do
content: Can Justin Fields and Aaron Rodgers sustain? Plus, Ben Solak begs the Giants to hold off on Jaxson Dart.

title: Phillies' Schwarber 1st in NL to reach 50 homers
content: Philadelphia slugger Kyle Schwarber hit his 50th home run of the season, a three-run shot off reliever Justin Hagenman in the seventh inning that gave the Phillies a 7-1 lead en route to a comfortable 9-3 victory over the Mets.

title: Source: Jets cutting Gipson after costly fumble
content: The Jets are cutting Xavier Gipson after his costly kick return fumble during Sunday's loss to the Steelers, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: Poch defends U.S. players: 'Criticize me,' not them
content: United States coach Mauricio Pochettino defended his players and said criticism of the team should be directed at him and not his roster after Tuesday's 2-0 victory over Japan at Lower.com Field in Columbus, Ohio.

title: Storm edge Valkyries to snag final playoff spot
content: The Storm clinched the 20th postseason appearance in franchise history by holding off the Valkyries in a 74-73 win Tuesday night.

title: Yanks' relief collapses as Tigers reel off 9-run 7th
content: The Tigers turned a 2-2 game into a blowout, exploding for nine runs in the seventh inning to defeat the Yankees 12-2 on Tuesday night.

title: Buckeyes' Day no fan of proposed portal changes
content: Ohio State coach Ryan Day is not a fan of proposed changes to the NCAA transfer portal, saying the potential move to a single transfer window in January "doesn't make any sense."

title: ⏪ Recapping John Cena's career
content: We highlight the key moments from Cena's remarkable 23-year career before he retires the jorts in December.

title: Who will win MVP, Cy Young and more? Our MLB award predictions
content: We go inside the numbers as baseball's best players go head-to-head to close out the 2025 regular season.

title: The stories, the experiences, the hair: Rob Ryan has brought it all to the Trojans
content: Even though Rob Ryan hasn't coached college football in nearly 40 years, he has already acclimated to life in L.A.

title: Early coaching landscape: Who's on the hot seat? Which seats have cooled?
content: Who could be on the hot seat? Who are coaching candidates to watch? Our experts explain the current coaching landscape.

title: Pulisic rates 9/10 as win vs. Japan gets USMNT back on track
content: Christian Pulisic was among the USMNT's best as Mauricio Pochettino's men bounced back from Saturday's shocking loss against South Korea to defeat Japan 2-0.

title: NFL execs predict the biggest award winners: Picks for MVP, best rookies, top comeback player, breakouts
content: Who will win MVP? Who will be the NFL's top rookies? Who is primed for a breakout? We asked execs and scouts for their picks.

title: Everything we're hearing for Week 2: Panic for the Dolphins? Big decision for the Giants?
content: Our insiders dove in on the aftermath of the Dolphins' disastrous opener, both New York QB situations and more.

title: Matchup rankings: Drake Maye, Ricky Pearsall stand out in Week 2
content: Matchups are the key to fantasy lineup decisions. Here are the most and least favorable for Week 2 at QB, RB, WR and TE.

title: WNBA awards tracker: Collier or Wilson for MVP? ESPN names its winners
content: Has A'ja Wilson done enough to unseat Napheesa Collier as the 2025 MVP favorite? We name our award winners.

title: Power Rankings: A new No. 1 -- and highlights for every team in final edition
content: The hottest team and the top team aren't the always same. See our final 1-13 as the regular season wraps.

title: Biggest early-season enigmas in our latest Bubble Watch
content: Putting the spotlight on select teams and question marks around others as the early playoff picture takes shape.

title: Travis Hunter effect is alive in the 2025 college football season
content: There won't be another player like Hunter. But his play has inspired other teams to look for two-way stars.

title: 'He talks a lot': Jayden Daniels, Brian Burns sound off on in-game trash talk
content: Burns noted that Daniels likes to talk on the field. Daniels pushed back on such a notion -- but not entirely.

title: MLB most exciting player bracket: Featuring the most electrifying star on all 30 teams
content: Witt or Judge? Ohtani or De La Cruz? We narrow the field -- with a rep from every team -- to one true must-watch player.

title: 'I felt alive again': Taking a look at No. 1 pick Cam Ward's NFL debut
content: Tennessee quarterback Cam Ward's debut didn't go as planned, but there were positives to take away from it.

title: NFL trade grades: Did the Eagles give up too much for Tank Bigsby?
content: The Eagles added some running back depth behind Saquon Barkley, but did they give up too much for Bigsby? We sized up the deal from both sides.

title: As difficulties mount at Man City, could this season be Guardiola's last?
content: Pep Guardiola's exit from Man City feels imminent and this season may be his last dance -- even if it means he can't go out on a high note.

title: How the new league phase format plays out
content: We're going to take you on a guided tour of the new UEFA Women's Champions League and show you how the draw and the format work.

title: 'I have to win': How competition -- in everything -- drives Crawford ahead of Canelo fight
content: Terence Crawford doesn't like to lose at anything. From playing cards to video games, he's as competitive as it gets.

title: All you need to know about Saturday's fight
content: Andreas Hale explains why Canelo Alvarez and Terence Crawford are fighting, what it means for boxing and more.

title: New faces, new places: Ranking the top 14 newcomers for the 2025-26 NBA season
content: Coach Mike Brown, Kevin Durant, Myles Turner and others are ranked by who will be the most impactful on their new teams.

title: Bills' big comeback: Long live-betting odds and shift in MVP, Super Bowl futures
content: The fourth quarter of the Bills-Ravens had it all -- including bettors putting down huge amounts on high odds.

title: Should you bet on Mateer or Moore to win the Heisman?
content: As odds shift for the Heisman Trophy and national title, Pamela Maldonado explains how to bet each of them.

title: The strangely specific transfer obsessions of elite clubs, and what the summer window taught us about them
content: Every team has preferences when it comes to transfers ... but some are more surprising than others. What did we learn this summer about Real Madrid's, Arsenal's and other elite clubs' fixations?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Madrid eye move for Stuttgart's Stiller
content: Real Madrid are reportedly keeping tabs on a possible move for VfB Stuttgart midfielder Angelo Stiller.

title: How to win your league: Expert picks, backup plans and more
content: If you read only one fantasy hockey story, read this one: your guide to draft, play and win your league like an expert.

title: Defense tiers: The elite, the roster fillers and everyone in between
content: Make your fantasy hockey draft strategy easier with detailed defensemen tiers and a guide to the position.

title: Delhi To Microchip 1 Million Stray Dogs, Draft Rabies Action Plan
content: Days after the Supreme Court's ruling on stray dog management, Delhi's Animal Welfare Board held a crucial meeting on Wednesday, announcing plans to microchip one million street dogs, regulate pet shops, and launch a rabies action plan.

title: Supreme Court Criticises 'Piecemeal' Examination Of Rape Survivor
content: Taking exception to a rape survivor's "piecemeal" examination by a trial court in West Bengal, the Supreme Court has raised questions over her deposition being adjourned for four months.

title: "Karisma's Children Already Got 1,900 Crore": Sunjay Kapur's Wife In Court
content: The high-stakes battle over late industrialist Sunjay Kapur's approximately Rs 30,000 crore estate played out in a courtroom on Wednesday after his wife Priya Kapur challenged her stepchildren's plea seeking share in his personal assets.

title: "Containing, Deterring, Interfering With China Futile": Chinese Minister To US
content: China's defence minister warned the United States that "containing, deterring, or interfering with China will be futile" in talks with his US counterpart on Wednesday, state broadcaster CCTV reported.

title: Seven UP Border Districts Put On High Alert Amid Nepal Crisis
content: Uttar Pradesh Director General of Police Rajeev Krishna said that security has been heightened in seven districts of the state bordering Nepal.

title: Karisma Kapoor's Children Have No Access To Sunjay Kapur's Assets: Sources
content: Bollywood actor Karisma Kapoor's children have no access to assets worth Rs 1,900 crore from their father's family trust, as claimed by Priya Sachdev Kapur, wife of late businessman Sunjay Kapur, sources said today.

title: Railways Releases Video Teaser Of Mizoram's Bairabi-Sairang Line Ahead Of Inauguration
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate the 51.38-km Bairabi-Sairang railway line during his visit to Mizoram later this week.

title: Mumbai Redevelopment Project To Unlock Over 44,000 New Homes: Report
content: The current redevelopment projects in the Municipal Corporation of Greater Mumbai region would add a total of 44,277 new homes at a value of Rs 1,305 billion by 2030, a report said.

title: Row Over Cross-Voting Snowballs, Congress's Manish Tewari Calls For Probe
content: The allegations of cross voting at the Vice Presidential elections by Opposition MPs has now blown up into a full-fledged political row.

title: 40 Parties Declared Rs 2,532 Crore Income In Financial Year 23-24: Report
content: Around 40 regional political parties declared a combined income of Rs 2,532.09 crore in the financial year 2023-"24, with more than 70 per cent of their funds coming through electoral bonds, according to an analysis by a poll rights body.

title: As Kathmandu Burns, 3,000 Nepalese Queue For Jobs In Indian Town 900 km Away
content: Far from the smoke and barricades of Kathmandu, around 3,000 Nepalese have gathered in Odisha's Jharsuguda, seeking scarce opportunities for government employment.

title: How Nepal's 'Gen Z' Is Turning Protests Into Viral Dance Videos
content: After years of frustration over unemployment, corruption, and political instability, Nepal's youth reached a breaking point. The immediate trigger was a sudden government ban on social media, pushing the country's youth onto the streets in fury.

title: "What Have You Done?" Chilling Saga Of Nepal Prince Murdering Royal Family
content: Any conversation on Nepal's monarchy brings to mind bloody memories of a chilling royal massacre that rocked the country in 2001. And this regicide, many say, had a Gwalior angle.

title: Ex Nepal PM's Wife Burnt Alive As Protesters Set His House On Fire
content: Rajyalaxmi Chitrakar, the wife of Nepal's ex-prime minister Jhalanath Khanal, died on Tuesday, say media reports, after protesters, led by Gen Z, trapped her in their home and set the house on fire.

title: Assam Shopkeeper Dumps Garbage On Road, Civic Officials Bulldoze It Back To Him
content: As you sow, so shall you reap. This shopowner in Assam's Tinsukia town learnt this lesson when a heap of commercial garbage that his shop had been dumping on the road was returned to it by municipal authorities.

title: Amid Unrest, 5 Nepal Jail Escapees Caught While Attempting To Enter India
content: In a swift action, the Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB) apprehended five prisoners who had escaped from a jail in Nepal and were attempting to cross into India, officials said.

title: 'Absolute Anarchy Everywhere': Indian Tourist Stranded In Kathmandu
content: Indian tourists, many from Karnataka and Tamil Nadu, are stranded in Kathmandu after unrest swept through the capital of Nepal, a tourist said.

title: Real Fight Is Priya Sachdeva Vs Karisma: Sunjay Kapur's Mother's Lawyer
content: Amid the ongoing dispute over late industrialist Sanjay Kapur's Rs 30,000 crore estate, Rani Kapur's lawyer said that the "real fight" is actually between Karisma Kapoor and Priya Sachdeva Kapoor.

title: DMK MLA's Employee Among 2 Arrested For Sexually Assaulting Disabled Man
content: Two men, including a personal helper of Bargur DMK MLA Mathiazhagan, have been arrested in Krishnagiri district for allegedly sexually assaulting a differently-abled man.

title: Seat sharing must balance winnable and tough constituencies, says Congress
content: Party asserts all mahagathbandhan allies in Bihar should contribute from their ‘kitty’ to accommodate new partners

title: Our slogan 'Vote chor, gaddi chhod' being proved across country: Rahul Gandhi
content: “When we investigated, we learnt that nearly one crore new voters had entered the election system after the Lok Sabha elections. Our and our allies’ votes remained the same, but all the new votes went to the BJP”

title: Probe into pension fraud in Kottayam municipality gathers momentum
content: Akhil C. Varghese, the accused in the case, taken to the Kottayam municipal office for evidence collection

title: Syrma Group to set up PCB manufacturing unit in Tirupati district of Andhra Pradesh
content: The ₹1,076 crore facility at Menakuru village is said to be India’s largest such unit and the first to be grounded under the newly-launched Electronics Components Manufacturing and Supply policy

title: Cabinet nod to construction of 4-lane Mokama-Munger road project in Bihar
content: The section passes through or provides connectivity to important regional cities such as Mokama, Barahiya, Lakhisarai, Jamalpur, Munger connecting to Bhagalpur

title: Women-run fuel station with EV charging station, supermarket to come up on 1.2 acres in Nalgonda
content: Zilla Majhila Samakhya’s contribution will be limited to the land allotted by the State government. It will get ₹40,000 per month as rent for 20 years, with a 10% annual increase.

title: Kerala Chief Minister is justifying brutal police assaults, says KPCC chief Sunny Joseph
content: Congress stages protests in front of police stations across the State demanding dismissal and jail for officers who brutally assaulted a Youth Congress leader

title: India significantly impacted by punitive tariffs, says Mauritius PM Navinchandra Ramgoolam
content: “We are unfortunately living in an era where predictability is becoming unpredictable and certainty is becoming uncertain,” Navinchandra Ramgoolam said

title: FIR against Facebook user for disrespecting Mahatma Gandhi
content: The post allegedly wished all teachers on Teachers’ Day, “except those who taught us Mahatama Gandhi got us freedom.”

title: Retired police officer relives memory at The Hindu’s Made of Chennai archival photo exhibit
content: “I read the newspaper regularly and about 20 days ago, in the archival photo column, I came across our passing out parade photograph,” says K.N. Murali

title: Malayali filmmaker Kunjila Mascillamani on the entering TIFF Directors’ Lab for ‘Guptam’ and struggles of indie female filmmakers
content: Guptam was among the 16 films selected for the TIFF Director’s Lab, and is backed by filmmakers Payal Kapadia, Jeo Baby and actor Kani Kusruti

title: Tracking Namma Metro
content: Where does Bengaluru’s metro connectivity stand? At what stage of construction and completion are the various lines at? We explore in this series.

title: Kerala State Electricity Regulatory Commission seeks seven years for liquidating KSEB’s revenue gap of ₹6,645.3 crore
content: The KSERC says that if the revenue gap of ₹6645.3 crore is to be liquidated by March 31, 2028, the Commission will have to impose a surcharge of “above ₹1 per unit on all consumers, including the subsidised categories” in the State

title: Forty regional parties declare ₹2,532 crore income in FY 23-24: ADR
content: The Bharat Rashtra Samithi reported the highest income at ₹685.51 crore, followed by the Trinamool Congress with ₹646.39 crore

title: Madras High Court quashes ‘false case’ against Sub-Treasury Officer for objecting to judicial officers’ bills
content: Justice P. Velmurugan said the case was fit to be quashed as it had been registered due to previous enmity between the Sub-Treasury Officer and a few trial court judges in Ooty

title: Nepal protests: Karnataka families stranded in Kathmandu left with only bars and restaurants for shelter
content: According to State government sources, more than 200 people from Karnataka remain stranded in Kathmandu.

title: Kerala MP Kodikunnil Suresh seeks special Central package for Kuttanad
content: The Mavelikara MP invites Union Minister for Agriculture and Farmers’ Welfare Shivraj Singh Chouhan to visit Kuttanad to witness its unique agricultural and cultural heritage

title: Mission Rabies: 10,000 stray dogs to be vaccinated in three-day drive in Kochi Corporation in Kerala
content: A 200-strong team to be deployed as part of the mass vaccination campaign of Worldwide Veterinary Service in November

title: Sonam Wangchuk, Leh Apex Body sit on fast in Leh over demand for Ladakh's statehood
content: Wangchuk also said the fast would be for 35 days and Gandhi Jayanti (October 2) would be a "landmark" in their protest

title: Kerala State Horticulture Mission urges farmers, primary cooperatives to make use of schemes for post-harvest management and marketing of horticulture crops
content: State Horticulture Mission has earmarked around ₹30 crore for developing infrastructure needed for improving post-harvest management and marketing of horticulture crops in 2025-26

title: AAP MLA Malik detained to ‘divert’ attention from Hazratbal incident: Mehbooba Mufti
content: "To book an elected representative under the PSA seems to be a tactic to divert attention form the situation in Kashmir due to the Hazratbal incident," Mehbooba Mufti said

title: 2020 Delhi riots: Umar Khalid moves Supreme Court against HC order denying him bail
content: Those who faced rejection include Khalid, Imam, Mohd Saleem Khan, Shifa Ur Rehman, Athar Khan, Meeran Haider, Abdul Khalid Saifi, Gulfisha Fatima and Shadab Ahmed.

title: T.N. CM Stalin takes part in Police Day celebrations in Chennai
content: Earlier this year, he had announced that September 6 would be observed as Police Day every year across the State

title: Where history meets hospitality: Kochi’s evolving stays
content: From colonial mansions and heritage bungalows to sprawling five-star luxury hotels and boutique retreats, Kochi’s hospitality boom has redefined the way the city welcomes the world

title: Jammu & Kashmir’s Doda remains tense; additional security forces deployed in sensitive areas
content: The arch of these restrictions has been widened to Bhaderwah valley, with all shops and business establishments shut in the town

title: Kochi, a city that greets the future with enthusiasm
content: The next 25 years promise greater transformation of Kochi — the extension of Marine Drive, expanded water and metro rail connectivity, and a climate-resilient city taking shape

title: Vallarpadam and Vizhinjam not rivals but complementary assets, says Cochin Port ex-chairman N. Ramachandran
content: N. Ramachandran says the way forward for Cochin Port is to leverage its strengths while adapting to changes in global trade

title: Colourful characters and men from Kochi who made sporting history
content: From Sreesanth’s unpredictable brilliance and controversies, to Sreejesh’s Olympic heroics and Eldhose Paul’s golden leap, Kochi’s sporting story is a mix of drama, resilience, and glory

title: Kochi’s timeless shores: from Neolithic settlers to global traders
content: From ancient settlers to global empires, Kochi’s shores echo with stories etched in trade, faith, and tradition; every wave that touched this coast left behind a fragment of its history

title: Allahabad HC grants bail to SP leader Azam Khan in Dungarpur 'forced eviction' case
content: Justice Sameer Jain allowed the bail in the appeal filed by a senior SP leader against his conviction and 10-year sentence given by an MP/MLA court in Rampur

title: Kochi’s culinary transformation: A quarter century of biryani, mandi, cafes, and modern menus
content: In 25 years, Kochi’s palate has evolved greatly, reflecting the changes in its culture, appetites and population

title: From looms to labels: Kochi’s fashion boom
content: From Chendamangalam’s flood-hit looms to couture studios and bridal ateliers, Kochi’s designers have woven a fashion story of resilience and reinvention over the past 25 years

title: Democracy under attack, Election Commission failing to ensure free polls, says CPI leader D. Raja in Kerala
content: Inaugurating delegates’ conference during CPI State meet in Alappuzha, D. Raja, referring to Bihar, says people’s right to vote is being ‘snatched away’

title: PM Modi ‘foremost leader in the world’, Home Minister Shah ‘Iron Man of India’: Sengottaiyan
content: Extending his greetings to C.P. Radhakrishnan on being elected Vice-President of India, Mr. Sengottaiyan, in a statement, said the nomination was a matter of pride for Tamil Nadu

title: The path ahead: shaping Kochi’s integrated transport network
content: Creating an integrated public transportation system has been a major challenge, particularly since the city has grown by happenstance in an unplanned way, with limited space for viable transit corridors

title: Malayalam rapper Vedan arrested in rape case on second day of questioning
content: Police say Vedan will be released on bail after completing arrest procedures as he had already been granted anticipatory bail in the case by Kerala High Court

title: Fearing TTE action, cool drinks vendor jumps off moving train in Kerala
content: Ashkar, who was selling cool drinks on the Alappuzha-Kannur Executive Express, was asked by the TTE to produce a ticket. When he failed to do so, the TTE allegedly warned him of legal action. Ashkar then reportedly jumped from the train and sustained injuries

title: Kochi-Muziris Biennale: the brightest jewel in the city’s crown
content: The country’s only art biennale of international clout shows the world what art is to the city, or rather what the city is to art. It is also the city’s biggest achievement when it comes to art and its showcase

title: Congress takes dig at PM Modi, reminds of Trump's ceasefire claims '35 times'
content: Are they so natural that President Trump has declared on over 35 different occasions that he brought about the India-Pakistan ceasefire on the evening of May 10th using trade as the instrument of leverage? questions Congress leader Jairam Ramesh

title: Accept notices, don't censor Opposition: TMC's Derek O'Brien lists suggestions for new V-P
content: TMC MP Derek O’Brien suggests newly-elected Vice President of India Radhakrishnan should prioritise parliamentary scrutiny and accountability

title: Building and navigating growth: Kochi’s port and shipyard eye new destinations
content: Cochin Port has been driving the growth of the city and its suburbs, fuelling industry, trade, and employment, while Cochin Shipyard Limited stands tall as the country’s largest shipbuilding facility

title: Kochi, the heartland of Mollywood
content: Till the mid-1990s, Kodambakkam was the famed hub of Malayalam cinema, but gradually ‘K’ came to mean Kochi; from big production houses and state-of-the-art pre- and post-production studios to modern screening facilities, the city has transitioned into the most sought-after destination

title: Kerala Startup Mission turns Kochi into a haven for start-ups
content: The start-up ecosystem is not a standalone system but is the by-product of many other ecosystems, which Kochi has in abundance owing to a slew of inherent advantages

title: Kochi emerges as gateway to Kerala’s IT dreams
content: Taking cue from the success of Technopark in Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala government had initiated deliberations to set up an IT Park under its aegis in Central Kerala, and Kochi emerged as the natural choice

title: U.S. doesn't need 'unfair trade' with India: Peter Navarro
content: White House trade advisor Peter Navarro’s remarks came on a day U.S. President Donald Trump announced that India and the U.S. are continuing negotiations to address the trade barriers

title: ECI top brass brainstorms with State poll machinery on pan-India SIR preparedness
content: There are indications that the exercise would commence later this year, ahead of Assembly elections in Assam, Kerala, Puducherry, Tamil Nadu and West Bengal in 2026

title: Open to accepting anyone other than Palaniswami as CM candidate, says Dhinakaran
content: Addressing the media, he said his party cadre would not accept Mr. Palaniswami, whom he called a “betrayer”, as the Chief Ministerial candidate

title: Delhi Police, Jharkhand ATS nab 2 suspected ISIS operatives
content: The prime accused, identified as Bokaro native Ashar Danish, was arrested from Ranchi. Another suspect, Aftab, was apprehended from Delhi during coordinated action carried out simultaneously by the teams

title: Andhra Pradesh Government steps in to monitor safety and rescue of 215 Telugu people stranded in Nepal
content: Andhra Pradesh RTG Minister Nara Lokesh to skip NDA’s ‘Super 6 Super Hit’ event. He will monitor early rescue efforts from the State RTG headquarters at Amaravati

title: After Aishwarya Rai, Abhishek Bachchan moves Delhi HC against morphed AI-generated videos
content: Abhishek Bachchan seeks Delhi High Court protection against misuse of image and fake videos, including sexually explicit material

title: Inspections at Absolute Barbeque outlets in Hyderabad uncover unhygienic conditions
content: The Food Safety Task Force visited the outlets following a complaint lodged with the Commissioner of Food Safety

title: Congress sends ‘impartiality’ reminder to Vice-President-elect; recalls words of S. Radhakrishnan in 1952
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge had extended best wishes to C.P. Radhakrishnan on securing victory in the election, while also expressing sincere gratitude to Sudershan Reddy for being the united Opposition's joint candidate

title: MEA issues travel advisory for Indians in Nepal
content: “In case of any assistance required, please call the Embassy of India, Kathmandu, on the following helpline numbers: 977 – 980 860 2881; 977 – 981 032 6134,” it said.

title: Karnataka High Court allows continuation of proceedings based on summons to H.D. Kumaraswamy on the allegation of encroachment of government lands
content: There were allegations that HDK had encroached upon certain portions of government lands, adjoining the lands owned by him at Kethaganahalli village of Bidadi hobli in Ramanagara taluk of Bengaluru South district.

title: SP MLA Manoj Paras sent to jail in attempt-to-murder case
content: Along with some other Samajwadi Party leaders, Manoj Paras, a former Minister and sitting MLA, was named as an accused in the case.

title: Enforcement Directorate arrests Congress MLA Satish Sail
content: The Karwar Congress MLA was arrested in connection with a money laundering case pertaining to illegal export of seized iron ore from Belekeri port in 2010.

title: West Bengal gives government-aided colleges ₹5 lakh each to buy books for libraries
content: While the amount may not be massive for bigger colleges, it is sufficient enough for smaller institutions that often have to think twice before taking decisions due to lack of funds

title: Pre-cocoon support rejuvenates Bodoland silk industry
content: Three years after the launch of a sericulture mission, the annual income of each silkworm rearer has touched ₹100,000

title: Presidential Reference hearing highlights: Not about the number of Bills withheld, it’s about whether a Bill can be withheld indefinitely: J. Surya Kant
content: Chief Justice of India B.R. Gavai, in the previous hearing on September 9, 2025 observed that Governors must act as “true guides and philosophers” to State governments.

title: Emergency cell set up at A.P. Bhavan in Delhi to assist Telugus stranded in Nepal
content: Suresh Babu has been designated as the Emergency Nodal Officer at AP Bhavan and may be contacted at +91 9818395787 for assistance

title: Police register three cases against protesters in Maddur
content: Cases have been registered against five persons for alleged pelting of stones at a place of worship, while another case was against an unspecified number of persons involved in tearing the buntings and flags in a locality. The third case is against a woman for hurling abuses against a religious community.

title: Kerala government hands over ₹17 lakh to nurse infected with Nipah encephalitis
content: The money allocated from the Chief Minister’s Distress Relief Fund was given to T.C. Thomas and Eliyamma, his parents, by Thottathil Raveendran, MLA.

title: Kozhikode, Malappuram see surge in mule accounts
content: The CBI has identified 8.5 lakh mule accounts in the country, while the Cyber Crime Coordination Centre estimates that the numbers could be over 20 lakh

title: Multi-pronged approach involving local communities sought to combat threat of swell waves
content: A report prepared by the agency on the directive of the National Green Tribunal has recommended the setting up of evacuation routes, beach nourishment, and spatial planning to minimise the impact of potential disasters caused by the phenomenon, locally known as ‘Kallakadal’ (‘rogue sea’)

content: As the first State-level urban commission in the country, the Kerala Urban Policy Commission’s report promises nothing less than a data revolution, governance recalibration, identity revival, and finance empowerment

title: Fantasy baseball news: Cubs' Tucker, Jays' Bichette hit IL; Witt returns for Royals
content: the fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . payton Tolle was originally scheduled to start today's game in Sacramento with the Boston Red Sox attempting to sweep the Athletics .

title: France unrest: Over 200 held, bus set on fire - What triggered 'block everything' protests?
content: France is currently experiencing widespread protests fueled by public anger towards President Macron's government. Demonstrators clashed with police, blocked roads, and set fires in major cities, leading to over 200 arrests. The unrest stems from austerity measures and political instability, with unions and activists demanding change and further action is expected, raising concerns about continued disruption.

title: iPhone buying guide 2025: iPhone 17 vs Air vs Pro — Which should you buy?
content: Apple's iPhone 17 lineup marks one of the most significant shake-ups in recent iPhone history. Gone is the Plus model, replaced by something entirely new: the ultra-thin iPhone Air. Combined with refreshed standard and Pro models, you've got four distinct options, each with its own personality and purpose. Let's break down each model to help you make the right choice.

title: Rohit Sharma practising for Australia tour? Truth behind viral video
content: A resurfaced video of Rohit Sharma practicing sparked speculation about his return, but it was confirmed as old footage from the 2025 IPL season. Despite concerns raised by a recent hospital visit, Sharma has cleared a fitness test and is set to join Virat Kohli in the ODI series against Australia, marking their return to international cricket after a break.

title: Nepal Gen Z protest: Who is Sushila Karki? Frontrunner to lead interim govt
content: Nepal's Gen Z protest movement, fueled by anger over corruption and a social media ban, has selected former Chief Justice Sushila Karki as its interim leader. Karki's neutrality and respected civic standing made her the preferred choice to represent the protesters in upcoming negotiations amidst violent unrest and curfews in Kathmandu.

title: Google tightens AI use: Coders face strict rules; external tools prohibited
content: Google is mandating its software engineers to exclusively use internal AI models for coding, driven by CEO Sundar Pichai's call for AI adoption to maintain competitiveness. Employees are expected to demonstrate AI proficiency, potentially influencing performance reviews and career advancement.

title: PM Modi speaks to Meloni: Trade deal in focus; Ukraine conflict discussed
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni engaged in a phone conversation, reinforcing their dedication to strengthening the India-Italy Strategic Partnership. Discussions encompassed bilateral relations, trade collaborations, and pressing global matters, notably the conflict in Ukraine. Modi expressed gratitude for Italy's support in finalizing a mutually advantageous India-EU trade agreement and advancing connectivity through the IMEEC initiative.

title: Pakistan spying on citizens: Chinese firewall used; millions risk privacy
content: Amnesty International reports Pakistan is employing widespread surveillance on its citizens using a phone-tapping system and internet firewall. The monitoring network, built with Chinese and Western technology, suppresses dissent and free speech. Pakistan's spy agencies can monitor millions of mobile phones via the Lawful Intercept Management System (LIMS) and block internet sessions using firewall WMS 2.0.

title: Asia Cup 2025: Shoaib Akhtar drops bombshell; makes massive prediction on India
content: Team India is gearing up for the Asia Cup 2025, starting with a match against the UAE in Dubai. Shoaib Akhtar humorously highlighted India's strong squad, while Suryakumar Yadav emphasized the team's aggressive approach. All eyes are on the highly anticipated clash between India and Pakistan on September 14.

title: 'If shedding blood …': Gen Z shakes Nepal – what do they want?
content: Nepal is witnessing violent protests led by its youth, triggered by a brief social media ban. The demonstrations, fueled by frustration over corruption and lack of opportunities, led to Prime Minister KP Sharma Oli's resignation. Protesters are demanding systemic change, including the dissolution of parliament and fresh elections. Despite Oli's departure, unrest continues, highlighting deep-seated discontent among Nepal's young population.

title: Kansas City Chiefs' 'heiress' Gracie Hunt shares family moments at Argentina's Iguazu Falls
content: Gracie Hunt shared her family's awe-inspiring trip to Argentina's Iguazu Falls on Instagram, capturing the majestic waterfalls, diverse wildlife, and serene golden hours. Her photos and heartfelt captions highlighted the spiritual connection with nature and the joy of shared family moments amidst the stunning scenery. The journey was a blend of adventure, reflection, and lasting memories.

title: iPhone 17 launch: Standard model gets price cut; Pro, Pro Max costlier
content: Apple has officially launched the iPhone 17 series in India, featuring the iPhone 17, 17 Pro, 17 Pro Max, and a new iPhone Air model. The series boasts a 48MP Fusion camera and 256GB base storage across the lineup. The iPhone 17 is priced from Rs 82,900, making it cheaper than its predecessor, while the Pro models are more expensive.

title: Asia Cup 2025: Jitesh Sharma explains evolution of finishers in T20 cricket
content: Jitesh Sharma highlighted the adaptability needed for T20 finishers, noting the uncertainty they face compared to top-order batters. He argued that traditional matchup theories are outdated, as modern batters innovate against all bowlers. Sharma emphasised the responsibility finishers bear, especially during team collapses, requiring instinctive planning adjustments in today's dynamic T20 landscape.

title: 'Closest to war since WW2': Russian drones over Poland push Europe to brink - 10 points
content: Tensions surged as Russian drones breached Polish airspace, prompting Warsaw to invoke NATO's Article 4 and scramble allied forces. Several drones were shot down, marking a significant escalation as it's the first time a NATO member engaged Russian objects within its territory.

title: 'India, China funding Russia's war': US envoy - more sanctions planned?
content: US Ambassador Matthew Whitaker claimed Russia's Ukraine operations are funded by oil sales to India, China, and Brazil, urging sanctions. India faces new tariffs amid accusations of benefiting from discounted Russian oil, which MEA has called unjustified. Despite tensions, Trump anticipates talks with Modi, signaling continued US-India dialogue on trade.

title: 'Phillies Karen' identified & fired after taking Harrison Bader home run ball from young fan
content: During a Phillies vs. Marlins game, Harrison Bader's home run ball was caught by Drew Feltwell, who gifted it to his son Lincoln. A woman demanded the ball, sparking outrage online and earning her the moniker "Phillies Karen." Despite mistaken identity claims involving Leslie-Ann Kravitz and Cheryl Richardson-Wagner, the woman's true identity remains unconfirmed.

title: Why top European stars are choosing Saudi Pro League over Europe
content: Top footballers are leaving Europe for Saudi Arabia. And lured by huge salaries, long-term contracts, and the country’s Vision 2030 sports project, Cristiano Ronaldo’s move to Al Nassr started the trend. This is followed by Neymar, Karim Benzema, N’Golo Kanté, Roberto Firmino, and younger names like Gabri Veiga. The Saudi Pro League now competes for global attention with Europe’s best.

title: 'I'm not part of that': Magnus Carlsen calls World No. 2 Nakamura 'shameless'
content: Magnus Carlsen has commented on Hikaru Nakamura's approach to qualify for the Candidates Tournament. Carlsen finds Nakamura's strategy shameless but pragmatic. Nakamura is playing in smaller open events to gain rating points. He recently won the Iowa Open. This victory brings him closer to his goal. Some criticize his choice of tournaments.

title: Shocking! CPL cricketers robbed at gunpoint - details inside
content: In Barbados, two St Kitts and Nevis Patriots players and a CPL official were robbed at gunpoint after a late-night food stop. The incident, occurring just before 3 am, involved the theft of jewellery and valuables. Thankfully, no one was injured, and police are investigating after recovering a dropped weapon.

title: Why Aaron Rodgers 'hides' his marriage; private life revealed
content: Star quarterback Aaron Rodgers, now with the Pittsburgh Steelers, has confirmed his marriage to Brittani, a relationship he's kept intensely private. Unlike many athletes, Rodgers shields his personal life, especially his marriage, from the public eye. He emphasizes Brittani's preference for a quiet life and how this privacy allows him to focus on football, avoiding distractions.

title: UAE: Emirates ID renewal and replacement in one step, check key details
content: The UAE has simplified Emirates ID renewal and replacement for citizens through a new single-step process. Under the Zero Bureaucracy Programme, applicants now only submit a form and pay the fee, with validity auto-assigned based on age. The system removes non-essential fields and is accessible via the ICP website and app, streamlining the entire customer journey.

title: Gujarat HC moved for stay of Jolly LLB 3 over judiciary's depiction
content: The Gujarat High Court has received a petition seeking a stay on the release of 'Jolly LLB 3', alleging that certain dialogues in the teaser degrade the judiciary's dignity.

title: 'I’ll go on strike if Jasprit Bumrah plays against UAE': Ajay Jadeja
content: Jasprit Bumrah's return for India's Asia Cup opener against the UAE has sparked debate over workload management, following his absence from recent England Tests. Ajay Jadeja questioned deploying Bumrah in a low-pressure game, while Irfan Pathan advocated for his consistent availability throughout the series. India faces a balancing act in ensuring Bumrah's sharpness for major tournaments without risking early burnout.

title: 'Not pursuing dollar alternative': CEA assures India's economic resilience
content: CEA Nageswaran clarified India's non-participation in initiatives to create an alternative to the US dollar, emphasizing the nation's economic resilience. Despite global trade tensions, India anticipates FY26 GDP growth in the 6.3–6.8 per cent range. Structural reforms, fiscal discipline, and a focus on innovation are key to India's continued economic stability and growth.

title: 'My first instinct was that people are losing lives': Dinesh Karthik on Bengaluru stampede
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru's IPL victory parade turned tragic on June 4, 2025, as a stampede claimed 11 lives. RCB has pledged Rs 25 lakhs to each bereaved family through RCB Cares. Batting coach Dinesh Karthik expressed the team's shock and grief, highlighting the profound impact on celebrations. RCB commits to long-term support, honouring the fans' memory with compassion and unity.

title: 'Karisma Kapoor’s kids got assets worth Rs 1,900 crore?': Delhi HC asks Priya Kapur
content: Following Sunjay Kapur's death in June, a legal battle has erupted over his Rs 30,000 crore estate. Karisma Kapoor's children are challenging Sunjay's will in Delhi High Court, claiming their share. The court has directed Priya Kapur, Sunjay's widow, to disclose all assets. Sunjay's mother, Rani Kapur, also questions the will, alleging exclusion.

title: '100% tariff': Trump asks EU to impose higher duties on Russian oil buyers India, China
content: US reportedly considers increased tariffs on nations buying Russian oil, including India. Donald Trump suggests tariffs of 50-100% on buyers like China and India. Trump wants the EU to act alongside the US. Discussions involved US and EU officials, plus Ukraine's prime minister. This comes as Trump said he looked forward to speaking with PM Narendra Modi soon to resolve trade barriers.

title: Gold prices fall from record highs! Go below Rs 1.09 lakh - here’s why
content: Gold rate today: Gold prices experienced a downturn, falling below Rs 1.09 lakh per 10 grams in domestic futures trading after reaching record highs. Profit-taking and weaker international markets contributed to the decline.

title: Bihar polls: Tej Pratap tours brother Tejashwi’s constituency; barbs fly
content: A political rivalry simmers as Tej Pratap Yadav, Lalu Prasad's elder son, distributed flood relief in his brother Tejashwi's constituency, Raghopur. This action follows Tejashwi's visit, where he inquired about residents' well-being. Tej provided essential supplies and medical assistance, subtly criticizing Tejashwi for a perceived lack of engagement.

title: Only MS Dhoni! The unique Asia Cup feat unmatched by any Indian captain
content: Overall, India have been crowned Asia Cup champions a record eight times — the most by any team in the tournament’s history. The list of Indian captains who have lifted the trophy reflects the country’s cricketing pedigree: Sunil Gavaskar (1984), Dilip Vengsarkar (1988), Azharuddin (1990, 1995), Dhoni (2010, 2016), and Rohit (2018, 2023).

title: Jumbo challenge: Tata Electronics build elephant-proof barrier in Assam
content: In a remarkable blend of technology and nature, Tata Electronics' ambitious semiconductor plant in Assam encounters an unexpected challenge: local elephants. These majestic creatures pose a risk to the precision manufacturing of chips. To address this, authorities are constructing a sturdy 'elephant-proof' barrier, with the support of the state. Furthermore, wildlife experts are safely relocating snakes discovered in the area.

title: Woman 'raped' at Singrauli railway station; forced to travel 300km to file FIR
content: A 25-year-old woman was allegedly raped at Singrauli railway station while her husband was away. Due to the absence of a female officer, she traveled 300 km to Katni to file a report. An officer from Jabalpur recorded her statement, leading to the arrest of the accused, Devlal Saket, who is now in judicial custody.

title: Why British horse racing has shut down nationwide for the first time in history
content: British horse racing faces disruption. Jockeys, trainers, and owners strike against a proposed tax hike. The government plans to raise remote betting tax to 21 percent. Racing bosses fear job losses and income reduction. Brant Dunshea leads the campaign against the tax. James Murray defends the tax rise, citing online gambling growth. The strike impacts all British racecourses.

title: Spaceflight increases aging: NASA study finds blood-forming stem cells at risk
content: A NASA-funded study reveals that space travel may accelerate aging by impacting blood-forming stem cells. Analysis of stem cells from International Space Station missions showed reduced regenerative capacity, DNA damage, and accelerated aging. These findings highlight potential risks to astronauts' long-term health, including compromised immunity and tissue repair, emphasizing the need for protective strategies.

title: Delhi: Woman jumps into Yamuna river from Signature Bridge
content: A woman reportedly jumped into the Yamuna River from Delhi's Signature Bridge on Wednesday morning, prompting an immediate response from authorities. The Delhi Police and Fire Service swiftly launched search and rescue operations, deploying divers to comb the river beneath the bridge.

title: 'Rahul go back': UP minister sits on dharna on highway; demands apology over insult to PM's mother
content: In Raebareli, Uttar Pradesh, tensions flared as BJP workers, led by state minister Dinesh Pratap Singh, attempted to halt Congress MP Rahul Gandhi's convoy during his two-day visit. Minister Singh staged a dharna on a highway, demanding Gandhi apologize for alleged insults directed at Prime Minister Narendra Modi's mother during a Congress' Vote Adhikar Yatra in Bihar.

title: Battle over Sunjay Kapur's will: HC asks wife Priya to disclose all assets
content: Karisma Kapoor's children have petitioned the Delhi High Court, seeking their rightful share of their late father Sunjay Kapur's substantial Rs 30,000 crore estate. They allege that their stepmother, Priya Kapur, fabricated the will to gain complete control over the assets. The court has issued a notice and requested a detailed list of Sunjay Kapur's assets.

title: Campus hiring revival! Infosys invites senior employees for college interviews
content: Infosys is resuming campus hiring after a two-year pause, deploying experienced staff for university interviews nationwide to recruit digital specialist engineers. Employees at managerial levels and above, meeting specific performance criteria, can volunteer as interview panelists.

title: Bottom 10: The spitting distance between Florida and Arizona State
content: "Spitting off the Edge of the World" is here at Bottom 10 Headquarters . Pat McAfee donates all the sleeves that he cuts off his sleeves . "we're spitting off the edge of the world, out in the night Never had no chance, nowhere to hide"

title: MMA divisional rankings: How much did Nassourdine Imavov rise at middleweight?
content: Nassourdine Imavov beats caio Borralho in the uFC Fight Night main event . he moves up to no. 3 in the latest ESPN middleweight rankings . the other weight class in which rankings change is heavyweight, where Marcin Tybura drops out of the top 10 .

title: Week 2 Power Rankings: Stacking the teams, plus top newcomer performances
content: the Minnesota Vikings beat the Chicago Bears on "Monday Night Football" the Packers finished their opening week of the 2025 season with a comeback win . the Pittsburgh Steelers, the Green Bay Packers and the Buffalo Bills topped their power rankings .

title: Potential managerial and front office changes on the horizon
content: snitker's son, Troy, played baseball growing up . he hasn't made a final decision on whether he will return next season . his family believe that this will be his last year as manager .

title: 'Nacua must mix his oatmeal with cement': Rams can't overstate WR's importance
content: los Angeles Rams wide receiver Davante Adams saw the collision in the middle of the field . he was taken to the locker room after a concussion and receiving stitches . the third-year receiver finished with 10 catches for 130 yards, by far the leading receiver .

title: NFL says Carter's ejection serves as suspension
content: the Philadelphia Eagles star will not miss any future games for spitting on quarterback dak Prescott . the league would consider the second-year defensive tackle to have served a one-game suspension . this is an important distinction by the NFL, which establishes a precedent . he will forfeit his week 1 game check worth $57,222 .

title: 49ers put tight end Kittle on IR, cut kicker Moody
content: the 49ers placed tight end George Kittle on injured reserve with a hamstring injury . the last of those games is set for "Thursday Night Football" the earliest Kittle could return would be for the Oct. 12 game at the Tampa Bay Buccaneers .

title: Waiver wire: The key players to add before Week 2
content: Aaron Rodgers is a must-start in week 2 for superflex formats . the season has kicked off but there's still time to start fresh with a 0-0 record . a league wi-fi will be available in at least 50% of standard leagues .

title: What makes a baseball player exciting? We asked two rising MLB stars
content: a baseball player bracket skews young, with the average age (26.4) more than two years younger than the MLB average (28.6) . the bracket embodies several common qualities among our 32 entrants . "i just like seeing guys who can do a lot of different things on the field," says a representative .

title: Fantasy reaction: Bigsby trade a boon to Etienne's fantasy value
content: the fantasy football buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around the NFL . a big spike in Jacory Croskey-Merritt's start rate after his nice performance in Week 1 . Travis Etienne Jr. is the biggest winner here after leading the team .
